clinical_study.brief_title: Behavioral Signs of Consciousness Recovery in Patients With Disorders of Consciousness (DOCSIGNS)
clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of the Behavioral Signs of Consciousness Recovery in Patients With Disorders of Consciousness (DOCSIGNS)

brief_summary.textblock: Precise description of behavioral signs denoting transition from unresponsive wakefulness syndrome/vegetative state (UWS/VS) to minimally conscious state (MCS) or emergence from MCS after severe brain injury is crucial for prognostic purposes. A few studies have attempted this goal but involved either non-standardized instruments, limited temporal accuracy or samples, or focused on (sub)acute patients. The objective of this study is to describe the behavioral signs that led to a change of diagnosis, as well as the factors influencing this transition, in a large sample of patients with chronic disorders of consciousness after severe brain injury.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline score in the Coma Recovery Scale-Revised until study completion
primary_outcome.time_frame: From inclusion in the study until discharge or death, assessed up to 24 months
primary_outcome.description: The Coma Recovery Scale-Revised consists of 29 hierarchically organised items divided into 6 subscales addressing auditory, visual, motor, oromotor, communication, and arousal processes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline score in the Functional Independence Measure until study completion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From inclusion in the study until discharge or death, assessed up to 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: The Functional Independence Measure is an 18-item measurement tool that explores an individual's physical, psychological and social function

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline score in the Disability Rating Scale until study completion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: rom inclusion in the study until discharge or death, assessed up to 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: The Disability Rating Scale is an 8-item measure that assesses disability of individuals with moderate to severe traumatic brain injury at a wide range of functional levels from coma through community living

arm_group.description: Patients diagnosed as either in a Vegetative State or in a Minimally Conscious State

study_pop.textblock: Participants were subjects who were diagnosed as with UWS or in a MCS after a brain injury

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- documented medical diagnosis of CRS-R-based diagnosis of UWS or MCS at admission to the neurorehabilitation program
Exclusion Criteria:
- none
